item.title: Why Runway is eyeing the robotics industry for future revenue growth

review.headline_rewrite: Why Runway is eyeing the robotics industry for future revenue growth
bullets: New York-based Runway is known for its video and photo generation AI world models, or large language models that create a simulated version of the real world.
“We think that this ability to simulate the world is broadly useful beyond entertainment, even though entertainment is an ever increasing and big area for us,” Germanidis said.

“It makes it much more scalable and cost effective to train [robotic] policies that interact with the real world whether that’s in robotics or in self driving.”
Germanidis said working with robotics and self-driving car companies was not something Runway initially envisioned when it launched back in 2018.
It wasn’t until robotics and other companies in other industries reached out, that the company realized their models had much broader use cases than they originally thought, he said.
Robotics companies are using Runway’s tech for training simulations, Germanidis said.
He added that just training robots and self-driving cars in real-world scenarios is costly for companies, takes a long time, and is hard to scale.

item.title: 62 Best Labor Day Sales on Gear We've Tested—Just a Few Hours Left

review.headline_rewrite: 62 Best Labor Day Sales on Gear We've Tested—Just a Few Hours Left
bullets: The unofficial end of summer brings with it bargains on WIRED-tested gear, including home office essentials and some of our favorite gadgets.

- The best iPad: Apple iPad (A16, 2025) for $299 ($50 off)
- The best electric pizza oven: Ooni Volt Electric Pizza Oven for $630 ($270 off)
- Top-notch noise-canceling earbuds: Bose QuietComfort Ultra Earbuds for $229 ($70 off)
- Our very favorite chair: Branch Ergonomic Chair Pro for $449 ($50 off)—Use Code LABORDAY
- The best smart speaker: Sonos Roam for $139 ($40 off)
- The best fitness tracker: Fitbit Charge 6 for $125 ($36 off)
Tech Deals
It’s a small discount, but our favorite Bluetooth speaker very rarely drops below this price.
You can even pair it with other JBL speakers.
It’s easy to pair with your phone and it has excellent sound to boot.
It’s stylish and has nifty features like two built-in USB-C cables and a display that shows remaining battery, temperatures, charging rate, and battery health.
Get more nitty-gritty details in our full review.

item.title: The best Labor Day sales for 2025: Get up to $500 off gear from Apple, Dyson, Shark, Sony and others

review.headline_rewrite: The best Labor Day sales for 2025: Get up to $500 off gear from Apple, Dyson, Shark, Sony and others
bullets: Read more about how we evaluate products.

Best Labor Day sales: Engadget's top picks
Apple AirTag (four-pack) for $70 (29 percent off): These are the best Bluetooth trackers for iPhone users thanks to their vast finding network and accurate ultrawide band features for locating your things when they’re close by.
Just attach them to your keys, wallet or bag with the right AirTag holder and keep track of everything in the Find My app.
Apple MacBook Air (13-inch, M4) for $799 ($200 off): Apple's latest MacBook Air is the top pick in our guide to the best laptops, and it earned a score of 92 in our review.
The M4 model isn't a major refresh overall, but that's not a bad thing — the design remains exceptionally thin, light and well-built, with long battery life and a top-notch keyboard and trackpad.
Now it's a bit faster thanks to the updated chipset.

item.title: Pick up an Apple AirTag four-pack for only $70 in this Labor Day sale

review.headline_rewrite: Pick up an Apple AirTag four-pack for only $70 in this Labor Day sale
bullets: Read more about how we evaluate products.
If you're thinking about getting some of Apple's AirTags, now's the time to act — Amazon currently has a four-pack on sale for $70 thanks to Labor Day sales.
For Apple users, AirTags offer some large advantages over rival trackers.
Over larger distances, the AirTag network enabled by all Apple device users lets you track down an object you might have misplaced in a café.
You can also force an AirTag to emit a chime to help you home in an object's location, and and that sound is nice and loud to better help you locate it.
And it works best with Apple devices, so Android users may want to look at trackers from Chipolo or Pebblebee that use Google's Find My Device network.

item.title: The 79 Best Deals From REI’s 2025 Labor Day Sale

review.headline_rewrite: The 79 Best Deals From REI’s 2025 Labor Day Sale
bullets: Many of the best REI deals are on the company's house brand gear, but we've also pulled in deals from competing sales at Backcountry, Mystery Ranch, Hyperlite Mountain Gear, Zenbivy, and other cottage industry retailers.

- The best-value backpacking tent: REI Co-op Half Dome 2 Tent With Footprint for $224 ($75 off)
- The lightest 4-person backcountry shelter we've tested: Hyperlite Mountain Gear UltaMid 4 Pyramid Tent for $722 ($128 off)
- The puffer jacket you can wear anywhere: Patagonia Nano Puff Insulated Jacket for $167 ($73 off)
- Our favorite daypack: Mystery Ranch Coulee 30 for $142 ($47 off)—Use Code 25YEARS
- A great ultralight sleeping quilt: REI Co-op Magma 30 Down Trail Quilt for $247 ($82 off)
- A great lightweight rain jacket: Arc'teryx Beta AR Jacket for $511 ($89 off)
- The best family camping tent: REI Co-op Base Camp 6 Tent for $412 ($137 off)
- My all-time favorite ultralight backpack: Hyperlite Mountain Gear Southwest 55L for $339 ($60 off)
- Our favorite canister stove for backpacking: MSR PocketRocket 2 Stove for $44 ($16 off)
Deals on Tents
REI tents are some of the best deals around, even more so during sales.
With plenty of mesh, this will have better ventilation than the Base Camp above, but the rainfly doesn't come as low and the hoop design isn't quite a strong.
It features a a low-profile design, with steep sidewalls, and a solid, nearly full-length rain fly, which, combined make this a livable haven in a storm.
The Osmo fabric continues to live up to the hype, with much less water absorption than nylon tents in rainy weather, and there's a good amount of room for storing all your stuff.

It has no floor (though there are bug inserts available), and the sidewalls do slope inward a lot, but it's easy to pitch, roomy at the floor, and seriously, just try to find another shelter that actually sleeps 4, and weighs less than 2 lbs (the Ultamid 4 is 22.4oz/635g).
